```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)
library(discrtr) # A companion package for the book Introduction to Discrete Choice Analysis with `R`
library(mlogit) # Multinomial Logit Models
library(readr) # Read Rectangular Text Data
```



Invoke data set Mode from package mlogit. To do this you need to first load the package. This is a data set with choices about mode of transportation. This is done as follows:

```{r}
data("Mode")
```

Once you have loaded the data set, answer the following questions:

1. Describe this data set. How many variables are there and of which type (i.e., categorical/quantitative)?

```{r}
glimpse(Mode)
```


2. How many different modes of transportation are in this data set? What is the most popular mode? What is the least popular mode?

```{r}
table(Mode$choice)
summary(Mode$choice)
```

```{r}
ggplot(Mode)+
  geom_bar(aes(choice), color="black" ,fill="#566AAA")+
  theme_bw()
```



3. In general, what is the most expensive mode? The least expensive?

```{r}
summary(Mode)
```

```{r}
ggplot(Mode)+
  geom_density(aes(cost.car), color="black", fill="#492baa",alpha=0.6)+
  geom_density(aes(cost.carpool), color="black", fill="#092AAA", alpha=0.6)+
  geom_density(aes(cost.bus), color="black", fill="red3", alpha=0.6)+
  geom_density(aes(cost.rail), color="black", fill="gold3", alpha=0.6)+
  theme_bw()
  
```
Más caro: Car
Más barato: Carpool


4. Create a plot showing the univariate distributions of time by car and time by bus. Discuss.

```{r}
ggplot(Mode)+
  geom_density(aes(time.car), color="black", fill="#492baa",alpha=0.4)+
  #geom_density(aes(time.carpool), color="black", fill="#092AAA", alpha=0.4)+
  geom_density(aes(time.bus), color="black", fill="red3", alpha=0.4)+
  #geom_density(aes(time.rail), color="black", fill="gold3", alpha=0.4)+
  theme_bw()
  
```

5. How do choices relate to cost by the different modes?


```{r}

var_num <- names(Mode)[-1]

for (k in var_num){
  graf<-ggplot(Mode)+
    geom_boxplot(aes(choice, eval(as.name(k)), fill =choice), show.legend = FALSE)+
    ylab(k)+
    theme_bw()
  print(graf)
}
```
